2021_1.question: An object is placed at a distance of 60 cm from a concave lens of focal length 30 cm. Use lens formula to find the position of the image formed in this case.
2021_1.answer:
u = -60 cm, f = -30 cm.
1/v - 1/u = 1/f => 1/v = 1/f + 1/u = -1/30 - 1/60 = -3/60 = -1/20.
v = -20 cm. Image is 20 cm from lens on the same side.

2022_1.question: Unlike animals, plants do not have any excretory products as they do not eat food. Comment upon the statement with justification.
2022_1.answer: The statement is incorrect. Plants do generate excretory products despite not eating food. These products arise from metabolic activities such as photosynthesis (producing oxygen as a by-product), respiration (producing carbon dioxide), and transpiration (removing excess water). Other waste products may be stored in vacuoles, leaves that fall off, or as gums and resins in old xylem.
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.question:
Students to attempt either option A or B.
A. How many chambers are there in the heart of the following organisms? How is mixing of oxygenated and deoxygenated blood prevented in their body?
(i) Fishes
(ii) Humans
OR
B. Explain the mechanism by which the water is transported in plants?
2022_1.answer:
A. (i) Fishes have a 2-chambered heart (one atrium, one ventricle). They have single circulation, so blood is oxygenated in the gills and goes directly to the body, preventing mixing in the heart itself but there is no separate oxygenated return to the heart. (ii) Humans have a 4-chambered heart (two atria, two ventricles). The inter-atrial and inter-ventricular septa completely separate the left (oxygenated) and right (deoxygenated) sides, preventing mixing. 
OR
B. Water is transported in plants through xylem tissue. The main driving force is the transpiration pull generated by the evaporation of water from leaves (transpiration), which creates a suction force (cohesion-tension theory) pulling the water column up. Root pressure also contributes by pushing water up from the roots due to ion absorption.
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.question:
About 100 acres of forest land was declared as Natural reserve park. The following organisms were predominant in the Natural reserve park: rabbit, frog, grass, fish, fox, water insects, zebra, peacock, snake, trees, bird, owl, insects, tiger, vulture, duck.
Create a food web comprising two separate food chains with different producers by using the above data.
2022_1.answer:
Chain 1 (Producer: Grass): Grass -> Zebra -> Tiger.
Chain 2 (Producer: Trees): Trees -> Insect -> Bird -> Snake -> Peacock.
The food web would interconnect these chains (e.g., Tiger might eat Rabbit, Snake might eat Frog, etc.).
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.question: Draw and explain how the nerve cells help in transmission of impulses?
2022_1.answer: Nerve cells (neurons) transmit impulses electrically and chemically. A stimulus is received by the dendrites, generating an electrical impulse that travels along the axon to the nerve ending. At the synapse (gap between neurons), the electrical impulse triggers the release of neurotransmitter chemicals, which cross the gap and start a similar electrical impulse in the dendrite of the next neuron.
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.answer:

(ii) The phenotypic ratio in F2 is 9:3:3:1 (Round Yellow : Round Green : Wrinkled Yellow : Wrinkled Green). Out of 144 saplings:
- Round Yellow: 9/16 * 144 = 81

- Wrinkled Yellow: 3/16 * 144 = 27

2022_1.question:
Neha consumed boiled sweet potatoes and boiled eggs for breakfast. Help her to understand some steps in the process of digestion of the food taken by her by answering the questions given below.
Attempt either subpart A or B.

OR
B. Which of these food items contains fats? How is it digested?
C. Which of these food items is rich in starch? How is its digestion initiated?
D. The figure given below represents parts of the human alimentary canal. Which of these parts will have the maximum amount of digested food as soon as the process of digestion is completed?
2022_1.answer:
A. Boiled eggs are rich in proteins. Digestion is initiated in the Stomach. Enzyme: Pepsin. Condition: Acidic medium (provided by HCl). Gland: Gastric glands.
OR
B. Boiled eggs (yolk) contain fats. Digestion occurs in the Small Intestine where bile salts emulsify fats and lipase breaks them down into fatty acids and glycerol.
C. Boiled sweet potatoes are rich in starch. Digestion initiates in the Mouth with Salivary Amylase breaking starch into maltose.
D. The Small Intestine (Part O in the standard diagram) will have the maximum amount of digested food.
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.question:
Attempt either option A or B.
A. Puneet wanted to grow banana plants.
(i) Based on your knowledge on plant reproduction should he opt for seeds or any alternate method of reproduction. Justify your answer.
(ii) Offsprings of a banana plant usually show very little variation. What causes variation and are variations good or bad? Justify.
OR
B. Annie was conducting research on the number of fruits produced by watermelon under different conditions. She grew 25 watermelon plants each in both glass house A and B. She introduced pollinators in glass house A only.
(i) What difference will she observe in the number of fruits produced in the two glass houses? Explain with reason.
(ii) List 3 changes that will occur in a flower once it gets fertilized.
2022_1.answer:
A. (i) He should opt for vegetative propagation (e.g., using rhizomes/suckers) because commercial banana plants are often parthenocarpic (seedless) or have non-viable seeds.
(ii) Variation is caused by DNA copying errors (mutations) or sexual reproduction (recombination). Asexual reproduction in bananas leads to little variation. Variations are generally good as they enhance the chances of survival of a species in changing environmental conditions.
OR
B. (i) Glass house A will produce significantly more fruits than B. Watermelon flowers often require cross-pollination by agents (pollinators) to fertilize the ovules and form fruit. Without pollinators in B, fertilization and fruit set will be poor.
(ii) 1. The zygote divides to form an embryo. 2. The ovule develops into a seed. 3. The ovary ripens to form a fruit (and petals/sepals wither and fall).

2022_1.question:
The following activity is set-up in the science lab by the teacher.
He clamped an aluminium wire on a stand and fixed a pin to the free end of the wire using wax. Then he heated the wire with a burner from the end where the wire is clamped. Students observed the pin fall off.
A. If the teacher replaces aluminium wire by silver wire, will the students' observation change? Justify your answer.
B. Will the aluminium wire melt? Give reason for your answer.
2022_1.answer:
A. Yes, the observation will change in terms of time. Silver is a better conductor of heat than aluminium, so the heat will transfer faster, and the pin will fall off sooner.
B. No, the aluminium wire will not melt under these specific conditions because the melting point of aluminium (approx 660°C) is much higher than the melting point of wax. The wax melts first, dropping the pin, demonstrating heat conduction.
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.question:
Attempt either option A or B.
A. An element 'X' is stored in kerosene, and cannot be extracted from its ore using a reducing agent. 'X' forms an ionic compound on reaction with chlorine.
(i) Can we store 'X' in water? Give reason to support your answer.
(ii) Identify element 'X'. Name the process used and write the equation for extraction of 'X' from its ore.
OR
B. The domes of many building in Europe are made of copper. These domes now appear greenish in colour.
(i) Why do the domes appear greenish though copper is orange-red in colour?
(ii) In your opinion, should the copper domes be replaced by iron domes to overcome the problem of change of colour of copper domes?
(iii) Domes used to be made from thin sheets of metals. Why did the ancient architects use copper to make domes?
2022_1.answer:
A. (i) No, we cannot store 'X' in water. 'X' (Sodium/Potassium) reacts violently with water, producing hydrogen gas which can catch fire.
(ii) Element 'X' is Sodium (Na). It is extracted by the electrolysis of molten sodium chloride (Down's process). Equation: 2NaCl(l) → 2Na(s) + Cl2(g).
OR
B. (i) The greenish colour is due to corrosion of copper, forming a layer of basic copper carbonate (patina) upon reaction with moist carbon dioxide in the air.
(ii) No, iron should not replace copper because iron rusts (forms hydrated iron oxide) which is flaky and leads to structural degradation, whereas the copper patina protects the underlying metal from further corrosion.
(iii) Copper is highly malleable (can be beaten into thin sheets) and resistant to corrosion, making it durable for construction.

2022_1.question:
Sara took 2 mL of dilute NaOH solution in a test tube and added two drops of phenolphthalein solution to it. The solution turned pink in colour. She added dilute H2SO4 to the above solution drop by drop until the solution in the test tube became colourless. 40 drops of dilute H2SO4 were used for the change in colour from pink to colourless. When Sara added a drop of NaOH to the solution, the colour changed to back to pink again.
Sara now tried the activity with different volumes of NaOH and recorded her observation in the table given below:
S. No. 1: 2 mL NaOH, 20 drops H2SO4
S. No. 2: 3 mL NaOH, 30 drops H2SO4
S. No. 3: 4 mL NaOH, 40 drops H2SO4

Answer the following questions based on the above information:
A. If Sara used concentrated H2SO4 in place of dilute H2SO4, how many drops will be required for the change in colour to be observed? (a) 40 (b) < 40 (c) >40. Justify your answer.
B. Sara measured 20 drops of dil. H2SO4 and found its volume to be 1 mL. If Sara observed a change in colour of NaoH solution by using 3 mL of H2SO4, how many mL of NaOH did she add to the test tube initially?
OR
Sara takes 10 drops of dilute H2SO4 in the test tube and adds two drops of phenolphthalein solution to it. Then she adds NaOH dropwise. Sara observes a change in colour after adding 20 drops of NaOH. What change in colour would she observe and why?
C. Write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction taking place in the above experiment. Which of the following is true and why? The reaction is a (a) neutralisation and double displacement reaction (b) neutralisation and precipitation reaction (c) precipitation and double displacement reaction (d) neutralisation, double displacement as well as precipitation reaction.
2022_1.answer:
A. (b) < 40. Concentrated H2SO4 contains more H+ ions per unit volume, so fewer drops are needed to neutralize the same amount of base.
B. From the table, 2 mL NaOH requires 20 drops H2SO4. Since 20 drops = 1 mL, the ratio is 1 mL H2SO4 neutralizes 2 mL NaOH. Sara used 3 mL H2SO4. Thus, she must have used 3 * 2 = 6 mL of NaOH initially.
OR
Sara would observe a change from colourless to pink. The initial solution is acidic (colourless with phenolphthalein). Adding excess NaOH makes the solution basic, turning phenolphthalein pink.
C. Equation: 2NaOH + H2SO4 → Na2SO4 + 2H2O. Correct option is (a) neutralisation and double displacement reaction.
2022_1.subject: Science

2022_1.question:
Attempt either option A or B.
A. A hydrocarbon with the formula CxHy undergoes complete combustion as shown in the following equation: 2CxHy + 9O2 → 6CO2 + 6H2O.
(a) What are the values of 'x' and 'y'?
(b) Give the chemical (IUPAC) name of the hydrocarbon.
(c) Draw its electron dot structure.
(d) Name the alcohol which on heating with conc. H2SO4 will produce the above hydrocarbon CxHy.
(e) Write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction of CxHy with hydrogen gas in presence of Nickel.
OR
B. The electronic structures of atoms P (Oxygen) and Q (Sodium) are shown... 
(a) If P and Q combine to form a compound, what type of bond is formed between them?
(b) Give the chemical formula of the compound formed.
(c) The compound so formed is dissolved in water. Is the resultant solution acidic or basic in nature? Justify your answer.
(d) Write the chemical equation for the reaction between 'Q' and ethanol.
(e) What will be the formula of the compound formed when 'P' undergoes bonding with carbon?
2022_1.answer:
A. (a) Balancing Carbon: 2x = 6 => x=3. Balancing Hydrogen: 2y = 12 => y=6. Formula C3H6. (b) Propene. (c) Electron dot structure of propene (CH3-CH=CH2). (d) Propanol (or Propan-1-ol/Propan-2-ol). (e) C3H6 + H2 --Ni--> C3H8.
OR
B. (a) Ionic bond (between metal Q and non-metal P). (b) Na2O (since P is O, Q is Na). (c) Basic. Metal oxides dissolve in water to form bases (alkalis). Na2O + H2O -> 2NaOH. (d) 2Na + 2CH3CH2OH -> 2CH3CH2ONa + H2. (e) CO2 (Carbon dioxide).

Attempt either option A or B.
A. The arrangement of resistors shown in the above figure is connected to a battery.; The power dissipation in the 100 Ohm resistor is 81 W. Calculate
(i) the current in the circuit
(ii) the reading in the voltmeter V2
(iii) the reading in the voltmeter V1
OR
B. An electric heater consists of three similar heating elements A, B and C, connected as shown in the figure above. Each heating element is rated as 1.2 kW, 240 V and has constant resistance. S1, S2 and S3 are respective switches. The circuit is connected to a 240 V supply.
(i) Calculate the resistance of one heating element.
(ii) Calculate the current in each resistor when only S1 and S3 are closed.
(iii) Calculate the power dissipated across A when S1, S2 and S3 are closed.
2022_1.answer:
A. (i) P = I^2 R. 81 = I^2 * 100. I = 0.9 A. (ii) V2 is across 25||25 = 12.5 Ohm. V2 = 0.9 * 12.5 = 11.25 V. (iii) V1 is across 100 Ohm. V1 = 0.9 * 100 = 90 V.
OR
B. (i) R = V^2/P = 240^2 / 1200 = 48 Ohm. (ii) S1, S3 closed -> A and C in parallel across 240V. I = 240/48 = 5 A in each. (iii) S1, S2, S3 closed -> A, B, C in parallel. Power across A is still 1.2 kW (1200 W) as voltage is 240V.

2024_4.question: (B) The colour of clear sky from the earth appears blue but from the space it appears black. Why ?
2024_4.answer: On earth, the atmosphere scatters sunlight, with blue light scattered the most (Rayleigh scattering), making the sky appear blue. In space, there is no atmosphere to scatter light, so the sky appears black.

2024_4.question: Use of several pesticides which results in excessive accumulation of pesticides in rivers or ponds, is a matter of deep concern. Justify this statement.
2024_4.answer: Pesticides are non-biodegradable chemicals. They enter the food chain and their concentration increases at successive trophic levels, a phenomenon called biological magnification. This accumulation can be harmful to organisms, especially those at the top of the food chain like humans.

2024_4.question:

2024_4.answer:
(i) Acid is added to increase the electrical conductivity of water. Cathode: Hydrogen. Anode: Oxygen. Relationship: Volume at Cathode (H2) = 2 × Volume at Anode (O2).
(ii) Silver chloride turns grey. This is a photolytic decomposition reaction (formation of Silver metal and Chlorine gas).

2024_4.question:

(iii) Dry HCl gas does not change the colour of dry blue litmus paper. Why ?
2024_4.answer:
(i) Add the concentrated acid slowly to water with constant stirring. Never add water to acid.
(ii) Sodium sulphate (Na2SO4). pH is 7 (neutral).
(iii) Dry HCl does not dissociate into ions (H+) in the absence of water. Litmus paper changes colour only in the presence of H+ ions.

2024_4.question:
(A) (i) How does Paramecium obtain its food ?
(ii) List the role of each of the following in our digestive system :
(a) Hydrochloric acid
(b) Trypsin
(c) Muscular walls of stomach
(d) Salivary amylase
2024_4.answer:
(i) Paramecium uses cilia to sweep food particles from water into its oral groove, forming a food vacuole.
(ii) (a) HCl: Creates acidic medium for enzyme action (Pepsin) and kills bacteria. (b) Trypsin: Digests proteins. (c) Muscular walls: Churn food to mix with digestive juices. (d) Salivary amylase: Breaks down starch into sugar.

2024_4.question:
(B) (i) What is double circulation ?
(ii) Why is the separation of the right side and the left side of the heart useful ? How does it help birds and mammals ?
2024_4.answer:
(i) Double circulation is a system where blood passes through the heart twice in one complete cycle of the body (Pulmonary and Systemic circulation).
(ii) It prevents mixing of oxygenated and deoxygenated blood. This ensures an efficient supply of oxygen to the body, which is essential for birds and mammals to maintain their high energy needs and constant body temperature.

2024_4.question:
(A) Define the following terms in the context of a diverging mirror :
(i) Principal focus
(ii) Focal length
Draw a labelled ray diagram to illustrate your answer.
2024_4.answer:
(i) Principal Focus: The point on the principal axis where rays of light parallel to the principal axis appear to diverge from after reflection.
(ii) Focal Length: The distance between the pole of the mirror and its principal focus.
(Diagram required showing convex mirror with parallel rays diverging from focus behind the mirror).

2024_4.question: (B) An object of height 10 cm is placed 25 cm away from the optical centre of a converging lens of focal length 15 cm. Calculate the image-distance and height of the image formed.
2024_4.answer:
Using lens formula 1/f = 1/v - 1/u:
1/15 = 1/v - 1/(-25) => 1/v = 1/15 - 1/25 = (5-3)/75 = 2/75. v = +37.5 cm.
Magnification m = v/u = 37.5 / -25 = -1.5.
Height of image h' = m * h = -1.5 * 10 = -15 cm.
Image distance is 37.5 cm, height is 15 cm (inverted).

2024_4.question: The power of a lens is +4D. Find the focal length of this lens. An object is placed at a distance of 50 cm from the optical centre of this lens. State the nature and magnification of the image formed by the lens and also draw a ray diagram to justify your answer.
2024_4.answer:
Focal length f = 1/P = 1/4 m = 0.25 m = 25 cm.
Object distance u = 50 cm. Since u = 2f, the image is formed at 2f on the other side.
Nature: Real, Inverted, Same size.
Magnification: -1.
(Diagram required: Convex lens, Object at 2F1, Image at 2F2).

2024_4.question:
(A) (i) Why is an alternating current (A.C.) considered to be advantageous over direct current (D.C.) for the long distance transmission of electric power ?
(ii) How is the type of current used in household supply different from the one given by a battery of dry cells ?
(iii) How does an electric fuse prevent the electric circuit and the appliances from a possible damage due to short circuiting or overloading.
2024_4.answer:
(i) AC can be transmitted over long distances with minimal energy loss by stepping up the voltage using transformers.
(ii) Household supply is AC (changes direction periodically), while dry cells provide DC (unidirectional current).
(iii) The fuse wire has a low melting point. If current exceeds the safe limit (due to short circuit/overload), the heat generated melts the fuse wire, breaking the circuit and preventing damage.

2024_4.question: (B) For the current carrying solenoid as shown, draw magnetic field lines and give reason to explain that out of the three points A, B and C, at which point the field strength is maximum and at which point it is minimum ?
2024_4.answer:
Point A is inside the solenoid, B is outside, C is at the end.
Field strength is maximum at A (inside) because field lines are concentrated and parallel (uniform). It is minimum at B (outside) where field lines are sparse.

2024_4.question: Write one difference between biodegradable and non-biodegradable wastes. List two impacts of each type of the accumulated waste on environment if not disposed off properly.
2024_4.answer:
Difference: Biodegradable wastes are broken down by biological processes (microbes), while non-biodegradable wastes are not.
Impacts (Biodegradable): 1. Foul smell/pollution. 2. Breeding ground for disease vectors.
Impacts (Non-biodegradable): 1. Soil/Water pollution (clogging drains). 2. Biological magnification in food chains.

2024_4.question:
(A) (i) Draw the structure of the following compounds :
(a) Butanoic acid (b) Chloropentane
(ii) How are structure (i) and structure (ii) given below related to one another ? Give reason to justify your answer.
Structure (i): Isobutane (2-methylpropane). Structure (ii): Neohexane (2,2-dimethylbutane).
Draw one more possible structure for above case.
(iii) Differentiate between saturated and unsaturated carbon compounds on the basis of their general formula.
2024_4.answer:
(i) (a) CH3-CH2-CH2-COOH. (b) C5H11Cl (e.g., CH3-CH2-CH2-CH2-CH2-Cl).
(ii) They are homologous (alkanes). They have the same general formula and differ by CH2 groups. Another structure: n-Pentane.
(iii) Saturated: CnH2n+2. Unsaturated: CnH2n (alkenes) or CnH2n-2 (alkynes).

2024_4.question:
(B) (i) What happens when a small piece of sodium is dropped in ethanol ? Write the equation for this reaction.
(ii) Why is glacial acetic acid called so ?
(iii) What happens when ethanol is heated at 443 K in the presence of conc. H2SO4 ? Write the role of conc. H2SO4 in this case.
(iv) Write an equation showing saponification.
2024_4.answer:
(i) Hydrogen gas is evolved. 2Na + 2CH3CH2OH -> 2CH3CH2ONa + H2.
(ii) Pure ethanoic acid freezes at 290K, forming crystals resembling ice (glaciers) in cold weather.
(iii) Ethene is formed (Dehydration). CH3CH2OH -> CH2=CH2 + H2O. Conc. H2SO4 acts as a dehydrating agent.
(iv) CH3COOC2H5 + NaOH -> CH3COONa + C2H5OH.

2024_4.question:
(i) Name and explain the two modes of asexual reproduction observed in hydra.
(ii) What is vegetative propagation ? List two advantages of using this technique.
2024_4.answer:
(i) Budding: A bud develops as an outgrowth due to repeated cell division, matures, and detaches. Regeneration: If cut into pieces, each piece grows into a complete organism.
(ii) Vegetative propagation: Production of new plants from vegetative parts (root, stem, leaf). Advantages: 1. Plants are genetically identical to parent. 2. Flowers/fruits are produced earlier.

2024_4.question:
(i) How is electric current related to the potential difference across the terminals of a conductor ? Draw a labelled circuit diagram to verify this relationship.
(ii) Why should an ammeter have low resistance ?
(iii) Two V - I graphs A and B for series and parallel combinations of two resistors are as shown. Giving reason state which graph shows (a) series, (b) parallel combination of the resistors.
2024_4.answer:
(i) Direct proportionality (Ohm's Law): V = IR. (Diagram required).
(ii) To ensure it does not significantly alter the resistance or current in the circuit.
(iii) The slope of I vs V graph is I/V = 1/R. Higher slope means lower resistance. Series combination has higher resistance, so lower slope (Graph A). Parallel has lower resistance, so higher slope (Graph B). Thus: (a) A is Series. (b) B is Parallel.

2024_4.question: The melting points and boiling points of some ionic compounds are given below : [Table with NaCl, LiCl, CaCl2, CaO, MgCl2 data]. These compounds are termed ionic because they are formed by the transfer of electrons from a metal to a non-metal... (i) Show the electron transfer in the formation of magnesium chloride. (ii) List two properties of ionic compounds other than their high melting and boiling points.
2024_4.answer:
(i) Mg (2,8,2) loses 2e- to become Mg2+. Two Cl atoms (2,8,7) each gain 1e- to become Cl-. Structure: Mg -> [Cl]- Mg2+ [Cl]-.
(ii) 1. Soluble in water. 2. Conduct electricity in molten state or aqueous solution.

2024_4.question: (iii) (A) While forming an ionic compound say sodium chloride how does sodium atom attain its stable configuration ?
2024_4.answer: Sodium atom (2,8,1) loses one electron from its valence shell to form a sodium ion (Na+) with a stable octet configuration (2,8) similar to Neon.

2024_4.question: (iii) (B) Give reasons : (i) Why do ionic compounds in the solid state not conduct electricity ? (ii) What happens at the cathode when electricity is passed through an aqueous solution of sodium chloride ?
2024_4.answer: (i) In solid state, ions are held in fixed positions by strong electrostatic forces and cannot move. (ii) Hydrogen gas is liberated at the cathode.

2024_4.question: The most obvious outcome of the reproductive process is the generation of individuals of similar design, but in sexual reproduction they may not be exactly alike... (i) Why an offspring of human being is not a true copy of his parents in sexual reproduction ? (ii) While performing experiments on inheritance in plants, what is the difference between F1 and F2 generation ?
2024_4.answer:
(i) Because offspring receive a mix of DNA from two parents and variations occur due to DNA copying errors and crossing over.
(ii) F1 generation plants are all genetically/phenotypically uniform (showing dominant trait), while F2 generation shows segregation of traits (both dominant and recessive) in a specific ratio.

2024_4.question: (iii) (A) Why do we say that variations are useful for the survival of a species over time ?
2024_4.answer: Variations allow species to adapt to changing environmental conditions, increasing the chances of survival of the species.

2024_4.question: (iii) (B) Study Mendel’s cross between two plants with a pair of contrasting characters. RRYY x rryy. He observed 4 types of combinations in F2 generation. Which of these were new combinations ? Why do new features which are not present in the parents, appear in F2 generation ?
2024_4.answer: New combinations: Round Green and Wrinkled Yellow. New features appear due to the independent assortment of gene pairs during gamete formation.

2024_4.question: The ability of a medium to refract light is expressed in terms of its optical density... (i) Determine the speed of light in diamond if the refractive index of diamond with respect to vacuum is 2.42. Speed of light in vacuum is 3×10^8 m/s. (ii) Refractive indices of glass, water and carbon disulphide are 1.5, 1.33 and 1.62 respectively. If a ray of light is incident in these media at the same angle (say θ), then write the increasing order of the angle of refraction in these media.
2024_4.answer:
(i) v = c/n = 3x10^8 / 2.42 = 1.24x10^8 m/s.
(ii) Higher n means lower angle of refraction r. Order of n: Water (1.33) < Glass (1.5) < CS2 (1.62). Order of r: CS2 < Glass < Water.

2024_4.question: (iii) (A) The speed of light in glass is 2×10^8 m/s and in water is 2.25×10^8 m/s. (a) Which one of the two is optically denser and why ? (b) A ray of light is incident normally at the water-glass interface when it enters a thick glass container filled with water. What will happen to the path of the ray after entering the glass ? Give reason.
2024_4.answer: (a) Glass is optically denser because the speed of light is lower in it. (b) The ray will pass undeviated (straight) because for normal incidence, the angle of incidence is zero.

2024_4.question: (iii) (B) The absolute refractive indices of water and glass are 4/3 and 3/2 respectively. If the speed of light in glass is 2×10^8 m/s, find the speed of light in (i) vacuum and (ii) water.

2025_5.question:
(a) Write the molecular formula of the following carbon compounds :
(i) Methane
(ii) Propane
(b) Carbon compounds have low melting and boiling points. Why ?
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) (i) CH₄ (ii) C₃H₈
(b) Carbon compounds have low melting and boiling points because the intermolecular forces of attraction between their molecules are relatively weak, requiring less energy to break them.

2025_5.question:
The electrons in the atoms of two elements X and Y are distributed in three shells having 1 and 7 electrons respectively in their outermost shells.
(a) Write the group numbers of these elements in the Modern Periodic Table.
(b) Write the molecular formula of the compound formed when X and Y combine with each other.
(c) Which of the two is electropositive ?
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) X (2,8,1) belongs to Group 1. Y (2,8,7) belongs to Group 17.
(b) XY (X loses 1 electron, Y gains 1, valency is 1 for both).
(c) X is electropositive (it loses electrons).

2025_5.question:
(a) Which of the following flowers will have higher possibility of self-pollination ?
(b) List the two reproductive parts of a bisexual flower.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) Mustard and Hibiscus (Bisexual flowers have a higher possibility of self-pollination).
(b) Stamen (Androecium) and Pistil/Carpel (Gynoecium).

2025_5.question: Which one of the two multicellular organisms — Spirogyra and Planaria reproduces by regeneration and why ? Give an example of any other organism which can also reproduce by the same process.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
Planaria reproduces by regeneration because it possesses specialized cells that can proliferate and differentiate into various cell types to reconstruct the body. Spirogyra reproduces by fragmentation.
Example of another organism: Hydra.

2025_5.question:
(a) What is variation ? List two main reasons that may lead to variation in a population.
OR
(b) (i) In a cross between violet flowered plants and white flowered plants, state the characteristics of the plants obtained in the F1 progeny.
(ii) If the plants of F1 progeny are self-pollinated, then what would be observed in the plants of F2 progeny ?
(iii) If 100 plants are produced in F2 progeny, then how many plants will show the recessive trait ?
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) Variation refers to the differences in characters/traits among individuals of a species. Reasons: 1. Errors in DNA copying. 2. Sexual reproduction (mixing of genetic material).
OR
(b) (i) All plants in F1 progeny will have violet flowers (assuming violet is dominant).
(ii) In F2 progeny, both violet and white flowered plants will be observed in a ratio of 3:1.
(iii) 25 plants (1/4 of 100) will show the recessive trait (white flowers).

2025_5.question:
(a) (i) Name and state the rule to determine the direction of force experienced by a current carrying straight conductor placed in a uniform magnetic field which is perpendicular to it.
(ii) An alpha particle while passing through a magnetic field gets projected towards north. In which direction will an electron project when it passes through the same magnetic field ?
OR
(b) (i) What is a solenoid ?
(ii) Draw the pattern of magnetic field lines of the magnetic field produced by a solenoid through which a steady current flows.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) (i) Fleming's Left-Hand Rule: Stretch the thumb, forefinger and middle finger of your left hand such that they are mutually perpendicular. If the forefinger points in the direction of magnetic field and the middle finger in the direction of current, then the thumb will point in the direction of motion or force acting on the conductor.
(ii) An alpha particle is positively charged. If it is projected North, the force on an electron (negatively charged) moving in the same direction in the same field would be opposite, i.e., South.
OR
(b) (i) A solenoid is a coil of many circular turns of insulated copper wire wrapped closely in the shape of a cylinder.
(ii) [Drawing should show field lines resembling a bar magnet: parallel inside the solenoid and curved loops outside, emerging from North and entering South].

2025_5.question:
(a) What is ozone ? How is it formed in the upper layers of the Earth’s atmosphere ? How does ozone affect our ecosystem ?
OR
(b) (i) List two human-made ecosystems.
(ii) “We do not clean a pond in the same manner as we do in an aquarium.” Give reason to justify this statement.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) Ozone is a molecule formed by three atoms of oxygen (O₃). It is formed when high-energy UV radiation splits O₂ into free oxygen atoms (O), which combine with O₂ to form O₃. It affects the ecosystem by shielding the surface of the earth from harmful ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the Sun.
OR
(b) (i) Gardens, Crop fields, Aquarium.
(ii) A pond is a natural ecosystem with decomposers that clean the waste naturally. An aquarium is an artificial ecosystem that often lacks sufficient decomposers, so waste accumulates and requires manual cleaning.

2025_5.question:
(a) List two advantages of adopting the atomic number of an element as the basis of classification of elements in the Modern Periodic Table.
(b) Write the electronic configurations of the elements X (atomic number 13) and Y (atomic number 20).
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) 1. It explains the position of isotopes (same atomic number, same place). 2. It relates periodicity directly to electronic configuration.
(b) X (13): 2, 8, 3. Y (20): 2, 8, 8, 2.

2025_5.question:
(a) Draw two different possible structures of a saturated hydrocarbon having four carbon atoms in its molecule. What are these two structures of the hydrocarbon having same molecular formula called ? Write the molecular formula and the common name of this compound. Also write the molecular formula of its alkyne.
OR
(b) (i) Write the molecular formula of benzene and draw its structure.
(ii) Write the number of single and double covalent bonds present in a molecule of benzene.
(iii) Which compounds are called alkynes ?
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) Structures: n-Butane (straight chain) and Isobutane (branched chain). They are called Isomers (Structural Isomers). Molecular formula: C₄H₁₀. Common name: Butane. Formula of its alkyne (Butyne): C₄H₆.
OR
(b) (i) Molecular formula: C₆H₆. Structure: Hexagonal ring with alternating double bonds.
(ii) Single bonds: 9 (6 C-H and 3 C-C). Double bonds: 3 (C=C).
(iii) Unsaturated hydrocarbons containing at least one triple bond between carbon atoms are called alkynes.

2025_5.question:
(a) Mention one function each of the following organs in human male reproductive system :
(i) Testis
(ii) Scrotum
(iii) Vas deferens
(iv) Prostate gland
(b) Name the type of germ cell which (i) is motile, and (ii) stores food.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) (i) Testis: Produces sperms and testosterone. (ii) Scrotum: Maintains temperature of testes lower than body temperature for sperm formation. (iii) Vas deferens: Transports sperms from testes/epididymis to urethra. (iv) Prostate gland: Secretes fluid that provides nutrition and aids movement of sperms.
(b) (i) Motile: Male germ cell (Sperm). (ii) Stores food: Female germ cell (Egg/Ovum).

2025_5.question:
(a) Three resistors R₁, R₂ and R₃ are connected in parallel and the combination is connected to a battery, an ammeter, a voltmeter and a key. Draw suitable circuit diagram to show the arrangement of these circuit components along with the direction of current flowing.
(b) Calculate the equivalent resistance of the following network : [Diagram showing R₁=5Ω in series with a parallel combination of R₂=10Ω and R₃=10Ω, followed by R₄=5Ω in series]
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) [Circuit diagram with R1, R2, R3 in parallel, connected to battery, key, ammeter in series, voltmeter across the parallel combination].
(b) R₂ and R₃ are in parallel: Rp = (10*10)/(10+10) = 5 Ω. The circuit is then R₁ + Rp + R₄ in series: 5 + 5 + 5 = 15 Ω.

2025_5.question:
(a) (i) Define Electric Power and write its SI unit.
(ii) Two bulbs rated 100 W; 220 V and 60 W; 220 V are connected in parallel to an electric mains of 220 V. Find the current drawn by the bulbs from the mains.
OR
(b) (i) State Joule’s law of heating. Express it mathematically when an appliance of resistance R is connected to a source of voltage V and the current I flows through the appliance for a time t.
(ii) A 5 Ω resistor is connected across a battery of 6 volts. Calculate the energy that dissipates as heat in 10 s.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) (i) Electric Power is the rate at which electrical energy is consumed or dissipated in an electric circuit. SI unit: Watt (W).
(ii) Total Power P = P1 + P2 = 100W + 60W = 160W. Voltage V = 220V. Current I = P/V = 160/220 = 8/11 A ≈ 0.727 A.
OR
(b) (i) Joule's Law of Heating states that heat produced in a resistor is directly proportional to the square of current (I²), resistance (R), and time (t). Mathematically: H = I²Rt (or H = VIt).
(ii) V=6V, R=5Ω, t=10s. H = V²/R * t = (6*6)/5 * 10 = 36/5 * 10 = 7.2 * 10 = 72 Joules.

2025_5.question:
(a) Name the group of organisms which form in the first trophic level of all food chains. Why are they called so ?
(b) Why are the human beings most adversely affected by bio-magnification ?
(c) State one ill-effect of the absence of decomposers from a natural ecosystem.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) Producers (Autotrophs). They are called so because they can produce their own food using sunlight and simple inorganic substances.
(b) Humans are at the top of the food chain, so harmful chemicals accumulate in maximum concentration in human bodies due to biological magnification.
(c) Dead and decaying matter would pile up, and nutrients would not be recycled back into the soil, disrupting the ecosystem.

2025_5.question:
The mechanism by which the sex of an individual is determined is called sex-determination. In human beings, sex of a newborn is genetically determined, whereas in some others it is not. There are 46 (23 pairs) chromosomes in human beings. Out of these, 44 (22 pairs) control the body characters and 2 (one pair) are known as sex chromosomes. The sex chromosomes are of two types — X chromosome and Y chromosome. At the time of fertilisation, depending upon which type of male gamete fuses with the female gamete, the sex of the newborn child is decided.
(a) Why is a pair of sex chromosomes in human beings called a mismatched pair in terms of type and size ?
(b) Out of male or female, which of them has a perfect pair of sex chromosomes ? In case of a perfect pair, will the gametes produced be of the same kind or of a different kind ?
(c) (i) Name two animals whose sex is not genetically determined. Explain the process of their sex determination.
OR
(c) (ii) With the help of a flowchart only, show how sex is genetically determined in human beings.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) Because in males, the pair consists of one normal-sized X chromosome and one short Y chromosome (XY).
(b) Female (XX). The gametes produced will be of the same kind (all containing X).
(c) (i) Some reptiles like turtles and crocodiles. Sex is determined by the environmental temperature at which fertilized eggs are incubated.
(c) (ii) [Flowchart showing XX x XY -> Gametes X, X and X, Y -> Offspring XX (Female) and XY (Male)].

2025_5.question:
A student fixes a sheet of white paper on a drawing board using some adhesive materials. She places a bar magnet in the centre of it and sprinkles some iron filings uniformly around the bar magnet using a salt-sprinkler. On tapping the board gently, she observes that the iron filings have arranged themselves in a particular pattern.
(a) Draw a diagram to show this pattern of iron filings.
(b) Draw the magnetic field lines of a bar magnet showing the poles of the bar magnet as well as the direction of the magnetic field lines.
(c) (i) How is the direction of magnetic field at a point determined using the field lines ? Why do two magnetic field lines not cross each other ?
OR
(c) (ii) How are the magnetic field lines of a bar magnet drawn using a small compass needle ? Draw one magnetic field line each on both sides of the magnet.
2025_5.subject: Science
2025_5.answer:
(a) [Diagram showing iron filings aligning in curved loops around the magnet, concentrating at poles].
(b) [Diagram showing field lines emerging from North pole and entering South pole externally].
(c) (i) The direction is determined by drawing a tangent to the field line at that point. They do not cross because if they did, there would be two directions of the magnetic field at the point of intersection, which is impossible.
(c) (ii) By placing the compass at the north pole, marking the direction of the needle, moving the compass so its tail is at the previous mark, and repeating until the south pole is reached. [Diagram with one line on each side].
